alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lamoille and northeastern Chittenden Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 207 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jericho, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Underhill, Jericho, Cambridge, Essex, Westford, Jericho Village, Essex Junction Village, Williston, Bolton, Richmond, Jeffersonville Village, Cambridge Village, Colchester, Milton, Hinesburg, Mallets Bay State Park, North Williston, Jericho Center, and North Underhill. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 72 and 83, and between mile markers 96 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
